item.title: South Croxted Road SE21 / Dulwich Wood Park junctio, 12th February
item.description:
South Croxted Road SE21 / Dulwich Wood Park junction roundabout – road hole just after exiting South Croxted Road on to round-about – road surface ‘wavey’ so underlying structure affected and area ‘crazed’ / about to break up. Google Streetview: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4282088,-0.0855707,3a,60y,30.7h,72.4t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sexWhD7qsKbIw0CluufHMfQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D17.604830697329405%26panoid%3DexWhD7qsKbIw0CluufHMfQ%26yaw%3D30.70438041072953!7i16384!8i8192?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI2MDIxMC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Croxted Road, Greater London

item.title: Collapsed Drain and broken pavements, 12th February
item.description:
Lorries (McGees) 8 wheelbased vehicles up to 10 at a time are parking daily on Paris Garde. Which are being used somewhere locally on a development. They are damaging the road and the pavements due to their weight and have caused a drain grate to collapse. We now have to walk in the road as the pavements are damaged and slippery with wet and mold from the green wall fencing. It is getting worse. There has been no road sweeper for dome time sweeping the pavements on both sides of the road. There is also a build up of litter in the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Paris Garden, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: College Road SE19 a few yards from streetlight ID, 12th February
item.description:

item.title: Sunken pavement, 12th February
item.description:
The pavement was sunk and had a big hole over a year ago. I reported it and someone came out and filled it with tarmac. Now a year later it’s sunk again and is getting worse. Numerous children have tripped on it, it’s damaging my tyres as it’s right in front of my drive so I have to go over it everyday. The ground has sunk and I’m worried it’s a sink hole as it’s getting worse and it could be hollow underneath the tarmac? It needs to be investigated and fixed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Westbrooke Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Thu 12/2/26 9pm - Blocked gulley drain (again) in Valley Rd, Shortlands, about 10m from the jct with Shortlands Rd, on the southern side of the road., 12th February
item.description:
Thu 12/2/26 9pm - Blocked gulley drain (again) in Valley Rd, Shortlands, about 10m from the jct with Shortlands Rd, on the southern side of the road. This is the Valley Rd side of maisonettes 7 and 8, Beech Tree Court, on the corner of Shortlands Rd. I saw that Council contractors had cleared the actual metal drain cover a day or two ago. However that has either blocked again or the blockage is further down the pipe. NB this location is the lowest point of the hills on Mays Hill Rd and the long hill on Shortlands Rd. I have seen gulley drains blocked on Mays Hill Rd, grass verges cut without smcolkecting the arising, and autumn leaves still uncollected in this road though it is now mid February. Economies of not collecting grass cuttings and autumn leaves is perhaps contributing to sludge-like plant material ending up in the Valley Rd drain. Please look at and address the wider contributing causes as well as unblocking these (two apparently) drains. Vehicles including buses and lmvans splash pedestrians and vehicles drive into the opposite carriageway. The ponding water is about 10m long x up to 2m wide.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valley Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
